TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlLanguageConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides type conversion for the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This converter exists primarily so that the existing `xml:lang` settings in an XML file do not interfere with the parsing of attributes that use as their underlying type. ## XAML Text Usage

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext typeDescriptorContext, Type sourceType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanConvertFrom(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext typeDescriptorContext, class System.Type sourceType) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
A type that represents the type you want to convert from.
Docs.summary: Returns whether this converter can convert an object of one type to the type supported by this converter.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method only returns `true` for `sourceType` of <xref:System.String>.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext typeDescriptorContext, Type destinationType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext typeDescriptorContext, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
The type you want to convert to.
Docs.summary: Returns whether this converter can convert the object to the specified type.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns `true` for `destinationType` of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor> or `destinationType` of <xref:System.String>.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext typeDescriptorContext, System.Globalization.CultureInfo cultureInfo, object source);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertFrom(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext typeDescriptorContext, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo cultureInfo, object source) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
The to use as the current culture.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified string value to the type supported by this converter.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the converted value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `source` value must be a string, otherwise an exception is thrown. If the conversion is successful, the return value is a <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage>.
Internally, this method calls <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage.GetLanguage%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. See <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage.GetLanguage%2A> for additional exception information.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext typeDescriptorContext, System.Globalization.CultureInfo cultureInfo, object value, Type destinationType);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext typeDescriptorContext, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo cultureInfo, object value, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
The to use as the current culture.
The object to convert. This is expected to be type .
A type that represents the type you want to convert to.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified to the specified type.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the converted value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For `destinationType` <xref:System.String>, this method returns the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage.IetfLanguageTag%2A> value of the provided <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage>. For `destinationType` <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor> this method returns an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor> instance that is useful for serialization. Other `destinationType` inputs throw exceptions.
